test_cases.objective: To ensure the system continuously monitors temperature in GMP storage areas as per URS-EMS-001.

test_steps.action: Set up temperature sensors in a controlled environment.
test_steps.expected_result: Sensors detect and display temperature readings.

test_steps.action: Monitor temperature readings for 30 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are continuous and recorded at ≤5-minute intervals.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and unaltered.

test_cases.objective: To verify the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint as per URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set temperature setpoint to 25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts and displays the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Simulate temperature deviation to 27°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert for +2°C deviation.

test_steps.action: Simulate temperature deviation to 23°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert for -2°C deviation.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated for both +2°C and -2°C deviations.
data_integrity_requirements: Alerts must be accurate and timely.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System continuously monitors temperature in all GMP storage areas as specified in URS-EMS-001.

test_steps.action: Access the EMS software interface.
test_steps.expected_result: Software interface is accessible and displays current temperature readings.

test_steps.action: Observe temperature readings for 30 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are continuously updated and recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are continuously monitored and recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as specified in URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 20°C.
test_steps.expected_result: Setpoint is successfully set to 20°C.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation to 22°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert indicating temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: System generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: Alerts must be accurate and timely

test_cases.objective: To verify that the system accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to -80°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The system should display a temperature of -80°C ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to +50°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The system should display a temperature of +50°C ±0.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the setpoint
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are accurately recorded and stored

test_cases.objective: To validate that alarm notifications are correctly integrated with the site paging system using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The system should generate an alarm notification.

test_steps.action: Verify that the alarm notification is received by the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: The site paging system should receive and display the alarm notification.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications must be correctly received by the site paging system
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are accurately transmitted and logged

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly integrates with the site paging system to send alarm notifications when temperature deviations occur.
prerequisites: Site paging system is configured and available

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C and configure the alarm threshold to ±2°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the configuration without errors.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation to 28°C using the test sensor.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alarm and sends a notification to the site paging system within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notification is received by the paging system within 30 seconds of deviation.
Notification contains correct alarm details (e.g., location, temperature value).
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm and notification timestamps must be accurate and logged.

test_cases.objective: Confirm that the EMS correctly archives and retains data for the required 7-year period using the vendor's archival feature.
prerequisites: EMS is operational with historical data

test_steps.action: Generate test data for a 7-year period (simulated or actual) and initiate the archival process.
test_steps.expected_result: System archives the data without errors and provides confirmation of successful archival.

test_steps.action: Attempt to retrieve archived data from 7 years prior using the vendor's retrieval feature.
test_steps.expected_result: System successfully retrieves the archived data with no corruption or loss.

acceptance_criteria: Data is successfully archived and retrievable after 7 years.
Archived data matches original records with no discrepancies.
data_integrity_requirements: Archived data must be complete, accurate, and retrievable.

test_cases.objective: Verify the EMS integrates with the existing facility management system using standard protocols.

test_steps.action: Configure EMS to interface with the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS successfully connects to the facility management system.

test_steps.action: Send a test data packet from EMS to the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data packet is received and processed by the facility management system.

acceptance_criteria: EMS integrates seamlessly with the facility management system.
Data transmission is accurate and reliable.
data_integrity_requirements: Data integrity must be maintained during transmission.

test_cases.test_name: Alarm Notification Integration with Paging System
test_cases.objective: Ensure alarm notifications from EMS integrate with the site paging system using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Configure EMS to send alarm notifications to the paging system via the vendor API.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS successfully connects to the paging system.

test_steps.action: Trigger a test alarm in the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is received and broadcasted by the paging system.

acceptance_criteria: EMS alarm notifications are successfully integrated with the paging system.
Alarm notifications are broadcasted accurately and promptly.
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm data must be accurately transmitted and received.
